HILLSBORO, WI 54634

citations.narrative:
The facility has re-used three identification numbers that have been used with in the past 4 years or less. Re-use of
animal numbers within 5 years isn't permitted by the regulations. Ensure that no animal identification number is used
within any 5-year period following its previous use.
***Correct by 11/21/2024.

About seven enclosure dividers have a metal edge that has rusted through in areas and has rough edges exposed where
dogs could contact the edge. Also one enclosure was observed to have a broke drain cover with rough edges that the dog
could touch. Rough edges or points that dogs can contact could hurt dogs. Ensure to maintain surfaces that dogs can
touch free from any edges or points that can cause injury.
***Correct by 11/20/2024.

The written Exercise Plan for Dogs that has been developed with and approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was
not available for inspection. An exercise plan with written standard procedures must be approved by the AV and available
for inspection and helps ensure dogs have adequate space and opportunity for exercise. Ensure to work with the AV to
develop and maintain a written program of exercise.
***Correct by 11/29/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.55(c) 
   
Removal and disposal of tags. 
The facility has re-used three identification numbers that have been used with in the past 4 years or less. Re-use of 
animal numbers within 5 years isn't permitted by the regulations. Ensure that no animal identification number is used 
within any 5-year period following its previous use. 
***Correct by 11/21/2024. 
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
About seven enclosure dividers have a metal edge that has rusted through in areas and has rough edges exposed where 
dogs could contact the edge. Also one enclosure was observed to have a broke drain cover with rough edges that the dog 
could touch. Rough edges or points that dogs can contact could hurt dogs. Ensure to maintain surfaces that dogs can 
touch free from any edges or points that can cause injury. 
***Correct by 11/20/2024. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The written Exercise Plan for Dogs that has been developed with and approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was 
not available for inspection. An exercise plan with written standard procedures must be approved by the AV and available 
for inspection and helps ensure dogs have adequate space and opportunity for exercise. Ensure to work with the AV to 
develop and maintain a written program of exercise.  
***Correct by 11/29/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
